page.title: 01NORTH DERBY
page.content: THIS BLOCK LIES ON THE NORTHERN FRINGES OF THE CITY OF DERBY BETWEEN 2.5 AND 5.5 KM FROM THE CITY CENTRE.IT INCLUDES THE NORTHERN PART OF THE{ALLESTREE ESTATE}ALONG WITH THE OLD VILLAGES OF{ALLESTREE}AND{ {QUARNDON.}THE NORTHERN PART OF THE BLOCK IS LARGELY AGRICULTURAL LAND, ALTHOUGH ABOUT 1 SQUARE KM IS OCCUPIED BY A LARGE MUNICIPAL PARK AND GOLF COURSE,NAMELY{ALLESTREE PARK.}FURTHER WEST ON THE MARGIN OF THE BLOCK A SMALL PART OF{KEDLESTON PARK}IS FOUND. THE RIVER{DERWENT}FLOWS NORTH TO SOUTH THROUGH THE EASTERN MARGINS OF THE BLOCK,WHERE ALSO CAN BE FOUND THE EDGES OF THE VILLAGE OF{LITTLE EATON} THE{A6}TRUNK ROAD ALSO PASSES THROUGH THE BLOCK FROM NORTH TO SOUTH, WHILE THE{A38 LEEDS-EXETER}TRUNK ROAD CUTS THROUGH THE SE CORNER OF THE BLOCK.
